title: Redfox #01 (1986) Harrier Comics UK Series
description:
I took a quick break from editing Aircel's Samurai to post the first issue of REDFOX

Redfox is a British fantasy comic published in the late 1980s, nominated eight times for Eagle Awards and winner of Best New British Comic in 1986.

Redfox herself first appeared in Dragonlords fanzine. Fox, the comic's artist and creator, used the strip to comment on barbarian fashion-sense in fantasy games, and later expanded his heroine's story into a three-issue Redfox fanzine.

The fanzine stories were revised and redrawn to form the early issues of a bimonthly US-format black & white comic. 

Harrier Comics published the first ten issues in the UK. Valkyrie Press was then established solely to publish Redfox.

Once Barry Blair's Samurai is up I will be working on the twenty issues of REDFOX.  Needless to say, I was a big fan of the 80's B&W comic scene and still have a huge collection that is waiting to be scanned.

ENJOY
